posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This gracious spell-sword is made to explore the fantastic synergy that these three charismatic classes have with each-other. Four attacks/ round, undispellable spell-casting, divine might and shield, both epic warding and epic mage amour, paladin immunities, tremendous saving throws and an effective divine wrath consist one of my finest creations up-to-date. There is almost nothing this battle-sorceress can't do either with her spells or with her blade and every necessary feat is there, albeit in a somewhat strict order since most of them need to be taken in a general feat level. In comparison to my "eldritch disciple" this one loses the ews and a couple of feats at the beginning, but her latent abilities are so much higher as to warrant the small sacrifice you are about to make. There are a couple of charismatic spell-swords like her and the best one is Xylophone's "blessed knight of mystra" but he doesn't have any spell-penetration feats and he miss both divine might and armour skin.

Xylophone's, Blessed knight of Mystra -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 18329.html

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Forumer is a tough one to master and so, i prefer not to edit my build but i should make a honourable mention to two other builds that might interest anyone that is looking for a charismatic spell-sword. Technically they are not the same build or classes, but they are too good to left unmentioned.

LuckyLion's Black Dragon -> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 17781.html

Mick Dagger's Transcending Knight -> http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/51 ... VJo53v-rtE

If you ask my humble opinion, they can't do all the things the "Battle Sorceress" can do, since both builds have different focusses and certain sacrifices have to be made in builds like this (can't have all, bummer), but as far as raw power goes they are a level above her. The first one has 38 AB with Dev. Crit. to boot and the other has 40 AB and 10 more strength. You simply don't mess with the RDD's... If you like, simply think of the "Battle Sorceress" as their little sister ;)

* Mick i hope you don't mind the name mispronunciation, i simply like thew old one better :)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
* Mick i hope you don't mind the name mispronunciation, i simply like thew old one better :)

 
The Transcending Knight is a build that got little attention back then, and rightfully so, at least power wise. Spellsword of Bahamut was the result of an attempt to improve that kind of spellswords. They are hard to do right, it is easy to go wrong and you have to stay very focused to achieve anything worthwhile.
The end result of my process towards a better (more powerful) spellsword was so different from the Transcending Knight that I had to call it something else than "Transcending Knight v2" even though it in a way had transcended to something better. The theme LG paladins and dragon disciples pointed towards Bahamut and I am comfortable with that.
I also like the old name, it implies transformation to something greater, but for the reason given above I decided to let it Rest In Peace.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: I hear ya Mick, although i think the "Transcending Knight" had some remarkable qualities (divine feats, 4th attack, low-level paladin spells) for it's time. The "spellsword of bahamut" was a general improvement though and i don't like the v.2 names either so that one was perhaps as good as it gets for a name. With these kind of builds you will never have everything you possibly want either, so you have to chose what to put inside, although the accumulated experience allowed for builds to be honed over time. With the "Battle Sorceress" i have everything i wanted in a spell-sword build, but on the other hand she doesn't have the raw power the dragon builds do, and i cannot think a possible way to get something more from her. Ah well, all these are more on a philosophical level as in-game these builds are so versatile and powerful that it really won't matter if we never get to the perfection ;)

Here is a bonus pic that shows her self-buffed, no items whatsoever. It really doesn't show how totally bad-ass she is in actual battle...

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I would actually advise you to do that tweak you yourself suggested and take Maximize spell, Val. Maximize spell makes it so that you can cast IGMS as a level 9 spell too, which can be quite useful in tie-ups. Plus, it gives you maneuverability over your spellbook for spending a slot 3 levels higher. Since you don't memorize anything in advance, it basically ADDS SPELLS that you need in slots that you can live without in all situations (as long as you have the spell, ofc). Much better than Spell Penetration. If you cast Mordenkainen's Disjunction, you can pierce max toolset SR.

Another thing that worries me is that you have EMA AND DS, but no Uncanny Dodge, which means you LOSE all your dodge AC when flat-footed. It can be devastating depending on who you face and the rules where you play.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Uncanny Dodge protects only Dexterity AC, not Dodge AC.
http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Uncanny_dodge

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Max, thanks for the advice and as i said you can always select one over the other, these tweaks are always upon the player and the specific environment that he/she plays. Other might opt to even have both penetrations feats and go with onlly still and empower for spell management. It really depends on where you play bro, Lolth in WoG for example has 50 SR, so you cannot always rely on beating max toolset SR only. Single player modules are different, i would probably take maximize spell there and so on. I still think the way she is now (balanced) is the best one for general purposes though.

And as for the Uncanny Dodge as Empyre said already it only protects against dexterity AC loss and not your Dodge AC or even Tumble AC, they are both gone when you are flat-footed. The best way to protect against this effect is to just play better, i explained these things amongst others, in my "Iron Fist" build a few days ago. I find you a little hard on a build that has 60 AC (with Concealment) totally self-buffed without any items, that goes easily to 69 AC with just boots of "hardiness +4" and a "shield +5", you don't need more with a spell-sword Max, they have other tools to take care of situations like these.

a) Shapechange to Iron Golem form and let them melt themselves to your damage shields.

b) Time Stop, then Greater Sanctuary and you can get out of the danger zone and return when you want, on your terms.

And these are but just two of the many methods that you have to turn the battlefield in your favour. Need even more AC? Bigby's Interposing Hand and Negative Energy Burst will do that happily for you. And you will have Concealment 50% from Displacement/ Improved Invisibility as well, do not forget that.
